ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How many siblings do you have?
Specifiy which sibling you are answering about:
Notes: 1= Sibling 1; 2= Sibling 2; 3= Sibling 3; 4= Sibling 4; 5= Sibling 5; 6= Sibling 6; 7= Sibling 7; 8= Sibling 8
1= Brother; 2= Sister; 3= Stepbrother; 4= Stepsister; 5= Half Brother; 6= Half Sister; 7= Adopted Brother; 8= Adopted Sister; 9= Other

0= NEVER DRANK: A person who (has) never consumed alcoholic beverages (i.e., a lifelong abstainer; teetotaler; never took a sip or taste.); 1= SOCIAL DRINKER OR LESS: A person who drinks moderately or less and is not known to have a drinking problem.; 2= POSSIBLE PROBLEM DRINKER: A person who you believe or were told might have (had) a drinking problem, but whom you are not certain actually had a drinking problem.; 3= DEFINITE PROBLEM DRINKER: Only include here persons who either are known to have received treatment for a drinking problem (including being a regular member of Alcoholics Anonymous), or who are known to have experienced negative consequences of their drinking (i.e., health problems, marital problems, etc.); 9= Don't know/don't remember
1= not confident; 2= somewhat confident; 3= very confident

0= NEVER USED: A person who (has) never used or even tried any illicit substances..); 1= SOCIAL/EXPERIMENTAL USER OR LESS: A person who has tried an illicit substance or inappropriately used a prescription drug but did not have a problem with it.; 2= POSSIBLE PROBLEM USER: A person who you believe or were told might have (had) a problem with drug use, but whom you are not certain actually had a problem.; 3= DEFINITE PROBLEM USER/ADDICT: Only include here persons who either are known to have received treatment for a drug problem (including being a regular member of Narcotics Anonymous or a similar program), or who are known to have experienced negative consequences of their drug use (i.e., health problems, marital problems, legal problems, etc.); 9= Don't know/don't remember
1= not confident; 2= somewhat confident; 3= very confident
